name: Poly Resonator
description:
"It's lots of Rings!" This algorithm is a polysynth where each voice is essentially a Rings (the open source Rings module by Émilie Gillet). Rings itself does support a kind of polyphony, but it’s limited to having a single pitch and gate input. This algorithm gives you a full Rings implementation for each voice, with shared parameter control.

Rings has an internal 'resolution' parameter (default 64), which is divided by the number of voices when polyphony is enabled. This algorithm allows manual resolution control (default: 16) to balance sound and CPU load.
short_description: "It's lots of Rings!" A polysynthetic implementation of the Rings module with adjustable voice count (1-8) and manual resolution control.
gui_description: The display shows notes being played by each voice. Voices decay indefinitely (theoretically forever).

specifications.name: Resolution
specifications.description: Number of resonator building blocks per voice (default: 16, equivalent to Rings with 4-voice polyphony)

parameters.name: Synth effect
parameters.description: If Mode is 'Synth', selects the audio effect applied to the synth output.

parameters.name: Resolution
parameters.description: Sets the resolution of the resonators. Higher values improve sound quality but increase CPU load.

parameters.name: Chord
parameters.description: Chooses the chord to use for resonator modes that support chords.

parameters.name: Noise gate
parameters.description: Enables a noise gate on the audio input. Always enabled in original Rings.

parameters.name: Odd output mode
parameters.description: The Add/Replace mode for the Odd output (0=Add, 1=Replace).

parameters.name: Even output mode
parameters.description: The Add/Replace mode for the Even output (0=Add, 1=Replace).

parameters.name: Dry gain
parameters.description: The level of the input audio mixed into the output(s).

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel to listen on.

parameters.name: MPE channels
parameters.description: Controls how the algorithm responds to MPE (Multi-dimensional Polyphonic Expression).

parameters.name: Bend range
parameters.description: The MIDI pitch bend range in semitones.

parameters.name: Sustain
parameters.description: Directly controls the sustain (like a MIDI sustain pedal).

parameters.name: MPE Y -> brightness
parameters.description: The amount by which the MPE Y dimension affects brightness.

input_ports.name: Audio input
input_ports.description: Main audio signal input for the resonator.

input_ports.name: Gate/CV inputs (standard polysynth)
input_ports.description: Standard CV/gate inputs for note triggering and pitch control.

input_ports.name: Audio input
input_ports.description: Chooses which input bus to use for the audio input.

output_ports.name: Odd output
output_ports.description: The bus to use for the Odd output.

output_ports.name: Even output
output_ports.description: The bus to use for the Even output.
